b12.title: Pregnancy imprints regulatory memory that sustains anergy to fetal antigen
b12.reason: This work phenotypically and functionally defines memory T Reg cells in a mouse model of fetal-maternal tolerance

b13.title: Cutting Edge: Self-Antigen Controls the Balance between Effector and Regulatory T Cells in Peripheral Tissues
b13.reason: This paper shows that persistent self antigen expression in tissues leads to the preferential accumulation of T Reg cells instead of effector T cells

b15.title: The Development and Function of Memory Regulatory T Cells after Acute Viral Infections
b15.reason: References 14 and 15 phenotypically and functionally define memory T Reg cells in a mouse model of infection

b30.title: Memory regulatory T cells reside in human skin
b30.reason: The paper phenotypically characterizes memory T Reg cells in normal human skin and in the skin of patients with psoriasis
